mdRecord.dcterms:title: Instructor clericalis: directing clerks both in the Court of Queen's-Bench and Common-Pleas: in the abbreviation and contraction of words (and thereby the speedy reading of precedents)
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: R. G. (Robert Gardiner), active 1690-1728
mdRecord.dcterms:description: On t.-p., v. 2-5: By R. G., a clerk of the Court of Common Pleas.

Sub-title of v. 2: Being a collection of select and useful precedents of declarations in the King's Bench and Common Pleas ...; v. 3, being a collection of choice and useful precedents for pleadings ...; v. 4-5, being a continuance of bars and other pleadings ..
Vol. 1, 5th ed., with additions; v. 2, 5th ed., cor. and enl.; v. 3, 4th ed., with additions; v. 4, 3rd ed., with additions; v. 5 (2 v.) 2nd ed., cor.

Vol. 2 has imprint: In the Savoy, Printed by E. and R. Nutt, and R. Gosling for J. Stephens; v. 3 and 5, Printed by E. and R. Nutt, and R. Gosling for J. Walthoe; v. 4, Printed by E. and R. Nutt, and R. Gosling, for J. Walthoe and J. Stephens.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Great Britain. Court of King's Bench.
Great Britain. Court of Common Pleas.
Pleading--Great Britain
Forms (Law)--Great Britain
